bibl.title: Territory of Washington v. Walker et al. Memo from the Justice of the Peace
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court For The Western District of Washington Northern Division

div1.p: Lockwood as charged by the Coroner Jury.

Wherefore the Court orders and adjudges that Charles Walker and Helen Walker be discharged and that M.A. Walker be held without fail to answer at the next term of the District Court for said offense. Dane in open Court this 21st day of July, A.D. 1885.
Alex Campbell Justice of the Peace

Charles Walker, Helen Walker, A.H. Thompson, Wm. Vale, Walter Osgood, T.W. Kirkbride, Jay U. Kelly, Grace Hunter, Emma Jay Arnold Henry Lockwood William Hunter Mary Whitam, H.F. McKay, James P. Wintermarte, Robert Albright, George Reich, E.H. Sherman, Henry Locke, R.M. Downey, Peter Fulmer & F.C. Miller, was each recognized in the sum of one hundred Dollars to appear at next term of the District Court as witnesses.
Territory of Washington Court of Pierce} ss
I, A. Campbell, Justice of the Peace in & for Second Ward Tacoma, as certify that the forgone as a full true and councel copy docked entrice in the above case except as to for bells.
